intro: Iridodictyum kurdicum, commonly known as the Kurdish iridodictyum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Kurdistan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
